programme.title: Young Bill Hickok
programme.desc: The frontier hero (Roy Rogers) sings and saves Civil War gold with his sidekick (George "Gabby" Hayes).

programme.title: Sitting Bull
programme.desc: President Grant helps a cavalry major (Dale Robertson) condemned for helping Dakota Chief Sitting Bull (J. Carrol Naish).

programme.title: 'Neath Canadian Skies
programme.desc: A Mountie (Russell Hayden) tracks mine robbers in 1890s Canada.

programme.title: Cowboy G-Men
programme.desc: The agents go to Wisconsin to investigate an Indian agent's claim.

programme.title: Cowboy G-Men
programme.desc: Pat and Stoney go to California to investigate reports of an anthrax epidemic.

programme.title: Petticoat Junction
programme.desc: Railroad executive Homer Bedloe arrives in Hooterville with a railroad tycoon, who is determined to purchase the Cannonball.

programme.title: Petticoat Junction
programme.desc: A man travels to Hooterville to investigate a line connection.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: A phony sheriff is part of a rustling scheme.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: Cisco and Pancho discover the shady motives of a lawyer hired to change a rancher's will.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Former deputies plan on robbing a gold shipment after their brother is killed.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Detective Matt Clark and his partner Frankie head to Tombstone, Arizona to find Doc Holliday with suspicion that Holliday is involved in the gang activity there; starring Jim Davis and Mary Castle.

programme.title: Judge Roy Bean
programme.desc: In Family Ties, Judge Bean comes to the aid of the Peralta family as unscrupulous real estate agents try to force them off their land. They've learned that a railroad will need the property and they intend to make an undeserved profit.

programme.title: Judge Roy Bean
programme.desc: Thieves posing as newspapermen attempt to blackmail a local rancher to steal his land and property.

programme.title: Annie Oakley
programme.desc: A clumsy fortune-hunter doubles for a notorious gunfighter.

programme.title: Annie Oakley
programme.desc: An outlaw (Myron Healey) poses as a marshal in an attempt to free his brother from jail. With Paul McGuire, Gail Davis.

programme.title: Hawkeye and the Last of the Mohicans
programme.desc: Hawkeye and Chingachkook rescue an elderly woman from two Indians who have kidnapped her and were about to take her back to their tribe.

programme.title: Hawkeye and the Last of the Mohicans
programme.desc: Hawkeye and Chingachcook set out to help a young Indian boy who has been raised by a white man, but they soon discover that the boy is the long-lost son of a Cree tribal chief.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: A shepherd ignores the Cartwrights' warning not to drive his flock across the Ponderosa; guest Everett Sloane.

programme.title: Grand Canyon Trail
programme.desc: Not long after ambitious prospector J. Malcolm Vanderpool takes an interest in the run-down remnants of a small frontier town, fortune seekers from all over rush to gain a silver mine of their own.

programme.title: I'm From Arkansas
programme.desc: A backwoods community is thrust into the limelight when a sow gives birth to an unprecedented number of piglets.

programme.title: Heartland
programme.desc: A Denver widow (Conchata Ferrell) with a daughter becomes a Scottish rancher's (Rip Torn) housekeeper in 1910 Wyoming.

programme.title: Mohawk
programme.desc: A barmaid, a Bostonian and an Indian (Rita Gam) flirt with an artist (Scott Brady) in 18th-century upstate New York.

programme.title: The Man From Utah
programme.desc: A tough cowboy has a head-to-head confrontation with a gang of outlaws using a rodeo as its base of operations.

programme.title: Fighting Caravans
programme.desc: A French girl (Lily Damita) joins a wagon train from Missouri led by two scouts and their young partner (Gary Cooper).

programme.title: Raiders of Old California
programme.desc: After the war with Mexico, cavalry officers try to steal land from Mexican peasants to establish their own empire.

programme.title: The Last of the Clintons
programme.desc: A cowboy sleuth (Harry Carey) catches rustlers despite a rattlesnake.

programme.title: Feud of the Trail
programme.desc: A cowboy (Tom Tyler) who looks like the leader of an outlaw gang becomes a hero when he helps a family badgered by gold thieves.

programme.title: The Range Busters
programme.desc: The Range Busters (Ray Corrigan, John King, Max Terhune) make their cowboy-trio debut, hunting a phantom killer.
